definition: paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc
to pile up/to heap up/a mass/pile/heap/stack/large amount
to dig into piles of outdated writings (idiom); to study old books and papers

sentences.english: Caused by the stack having a lower moisture level than the surrounding atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 成因是紙堆的水份含量較周圍的空氣低。

sentences.english: Large voids are found surrounding stacks of paper.
sentences.chinese: 在紙堆周圍可找到很大的空間。

sentences.english: Automatic control device of paper pile height.
sentences.chinese: 配有紙堆高度自動控制系統。

sentences.english: The action is to lift and forward the top sheet on a pile by the back edge.
sentences.chinese: 它在紙堆面上逐一提起紙尾然後把它送前。

sentences.english: The scholar delved into lots of old books and papers for the facts.
sentences.chinese: 這位學者鑽在故紙堆裏尋找資料。

sentences.english: He heard a mouse rustling among his papers.
sentences.chinese: 他聽見紙堆中有老鼠沙沙作響。

sentences.english: Negotiators and aides seemed to be drowning in paper.
sentences.chinese: 談判者和助手們看上去像是湮沒在紙堆裏。
